meanings.definition: The act or process of consecuting.
meanings.sent1: The consecution of tasks was completed one after the other.
meanings.sent2: The consecution of numbers in the sequence was easy to follow.
meanings.sent3: The consecution of events at the party led to a surprising outcome.
meanings.sent4: The consecution of decisions in the meeting formed a clear path forward.
meanings.sent5: The consecution of colors in the rainbow made a beautiful arc in the sky.

meanings.definition: A series or sequence of events or actions.
meanings.sent1: The consecution of days of the week is Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, and so on.
meanings.sent2: The consecution of scenes in the movie kept the audience engaged.
meanings.sent3: The consecution of jokes at the comedy show had everyone laughing.
meanings.sent4: The consecution of waves crashing on the shore was mesmerizing.
meanings.sent5: The consecution of steps in the dance routine was flawless.
